noun.name: spoon
noun.discription: a utensil with a shallow bowl-shaped container and a handle, used for scooping and serving food

object1.name: fork
object1.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a utensil with prongs, used for piercing and lifting food

object2.name: knife
object2.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a utensil with a sharp blade, used for cutting and slicing food

object3.name: chopsticks
object3.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a pair of slender sticks, used for picking up food in Asian cuisine

object4.name: spatula
object4.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a flat, broad-bladed instrument, used for mixing, spreading, or lifting food

object5.name: ladle
object5.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a large, deep spoon with a long handle, used for serving soup or liquid foods

object6.name: tongs
object6.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a gripping tool with two arms, used for picking up and handling food items

object7.name: whisk
object7.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a tool with a set of wire loops, used for beating and mixing ingredients

object8.name: rolling pin
object8.discription: in parallel with 'spoon', is a cylindrical tool, used for rolling out dough in baking
